Calls for improved public health literacy in medical education are prominent and have a long history.
56-60 This is based on the recognition that systems-focused, preventative, multidisciplinary approaches to health are crucial to address entrenched socio-economic and environmental disadvantage that still play out in health statistics. There has always been a tension between reductionist biomedical and broader public health paradigms. Yet medical education has been through several transformations and there is considerable momentum for a new transition,
10, 39, 61, 62 with approaches such as a three-pillared framework of basic, clinical and systems science,
